tweets.text: It is not getting any better. The gas stink from the landfill is increasing in intensity. A dreadful weekend and again tonight. No one should have to live like this. We are all looking for answers from @EnvAgencyMids and light at the end of this tunnel. @StinkStopthe https://t.co/JPdHJZJBqQ

@SimonTagg @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe I‚Äôve been grateful of a brake dew to wind direction, but the anxiety I have over when it will be back how bad will it be is off the scale I dread going to bed in case I wake choking on it affected even when no gas in my home #StopTheStink

Just come back from the Royal Stoke Hospital @UHNM_NHS it absolutely reeks. People are sick, receiving treatment now contend with @RedIndustries2 toxic gas @EnvAgencyMids @PHE_uk @MattHancock @pow_rebecca act now @BorisJohnson have you forgotten your pledge?#stopthestink https://t.co/PoctetAG5M

@EnvAgencyMids You suspended Clayton Hall Landfill‚Äôs permit when they had similar problems,which focused the operators efforts to fixing the odour issues.Why can‚Äôt this be done at Walley‚Äôs?The councillor said that was the single biggest action that made a difference #stopthestink

urls.title: Testing and sequencing of sewage ramped up to help tackle COVID-19 outbreaks
urls.description: The innovative programme to test wastewater for traces of coronavirus (COVID-19) has ramped up sequencing capacity to support variant detection.

tweets.text:
Measurements in sewage have been mapping the spread of Covid variants across England, including the Indian variant 617.2

Read how this works, and examples of how its been used in Luton and Bristol: https://t.co/bk5ULdMUUk

Great work of @EnvAgency & @CefasGovUK scientists

urls.title: Dorket Head landfill site in Arnold closes over 'smell'
urls.description: A landfill site which kept residents awake at night because the smell was so bad closes.

tweets.text: @SarahInNUL @AaronBell4NUL @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe It has come to my attention that the Blaydon closure was only temporary, but still, it was more robust enforcement than accepting a voluntary curtailment. Also, I suspect complaint numbers were similarly low for Dorket Head, which was closed permanently (https://t.co/LA0nxaHykq).

For miles around Walleys Quarry in Silverdale, people have reported waking up in the night struggling to breath.A  ‚Äústop the stink‚Äù Facebook page has been set to highlight the escaping hydrogen sulphide fumes.This is shocking @pow_rebecca @MattHancock?
https://t.co/DehURqq0oi
